ai.summary: A short, easy 2.2 km hike along the Former Chiltern Way in the UK. The route offers gentle terrain and countryside scenery suitable for beginners or casual walkers.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily gentle, well-maintained trails with a mix of grassy paths and compact gravel. Expect flat to rolling sections with a gentle rise, and occasional muddy patches after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Carry a light map or use offline GPS; wear sturdy footwear; check weather and daylight hours; stay on marked paths; watch for farm traffic and livestock; keep dogs under control; bring water and a small first-aid kit; inform someone of your planned route and return time.
ai.best_seasons: Year-round (best in spring and summer; autumn can be pleasant; winter may be muddy or icy).
